snippet: As a condition of assuming the key post, the Wisconsin lawmaker urged unity among factions in the fractured Republican Party.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and EMMARIE HUETTEMAN

abstract: Roughly two-thirds of anti-establishment conservatives in House Freedom Caucus vote to back Rep Paul D Ryan for House speaker, providing him enough support to secure post; vote falls short of four-fifths majority required to earn caucus's official endorsement but in combination with other Republican factions offers party unity Ryan set as prerequisite.
lead_paragraph: As a condition of assuming the key post, the Wisconsin lawmaker urged unity among factions in the fractured Republican Party.

headline.print_headline: Caucus Clears Path for Ryan to Be Speaker
headline.main: Paul Ryan Wins Backing of Majority in Freedom Caucus for House Speaker
